info.title: idocs api document
info.description:
Use the change API to change the subscription information, such as the subscription period rule, the payment amount for each subscription period, or other information. Subscription information can only be changed for subscriptions that have not been canceled or terminated.

Structure

A message consists of a header and body. The following sections are focused on the body structure. For the header structure, see£º

  • Request header
  • Response header

Note: Set the data type of each field (except array) as String. This means that you must use double quotation marks (" ") to enclose the field value. Examples:

  • If the data type of a field is Integer and its value is 20, set it as "20".
  • If the data type of a field is Boolean and its value is true, set it as "true".
info.descriptionLake:
Use the change API to change the subscription information, such as the subscription period rule, the payment amount for each subscription period, or other information. Subscription information can only be changed for subscriptions that have not been canceled or terminated.

Structure

A message consists of a header and body. The following sections are focused on the body structure. For the header structure, see£º

  • Request header
  • Response header

Note: Set the data type of each field (except array) as String. This means that you must use double quotation marks (" ") to enclose the field value. Examples:

  • If the data type of a field is Integer and its value is 20, set it as "20".
  • If the data type of a field is Boolean and its value is true, set it as "true".

subscriptionChangeRequestId.description: The unique ID assigned by a merchant to identify a subscription change request. Alipay uses this field for idempotency control.
subscriptionChangeRequestId.descriptionLake: The unique ID assigned by a merchant to identify a subscription change request. Alipay uses this field for idempotency control.
subscriptionChangeRequestId.x-idempotencyDescription: For subscription change requests that are initiated with the same value of subscriptionChangeRequestId and reach a final status of S or F, the same result is to be returned for the request.

subscriptionId.description: The unique ID assigned by Alipay to identify a subscription. The value of this parameter is the value of the same parameter that is returned by notifyPayment and notifySubscription for the original subscription.
subscriptionId.descriptionLake: The unique ID assigned by Alipay to identify a subscription. The value of this parameter is the value of the same parameter that is returned by notifyPayment and notifySubscription for the original subscription.

subscriptionDescription.description:
The description of the subscription, used for displaying user consumption records and other actions.

Specify this parameter if you want to change this information.
subscriptionDescription.descriptionLake:
The description of the subscription, used for displaying user consumption records and other actions.

Specify this parameter if you want to change this information.

subscriptionStartTime.description:
The date and time when the subscription becomes active. 

Specify this parameter when you want to designate the start time of the changed subscription. If you leave this parameter empty, the default value of this parameter is the time when Alipay receives this request.
subscriptionStartTime.descriptionLake:
The date and time when the subscription becomes active. 

Specify this parameter when you want to designate the start time of the changed subscription. If you leave this parameter empty, the default value of this parameter is the time when Alipay receives this request.

subscriptionEndTime.description:
The date and time when the subscription ends. The default value of this parameter is 2099-12-31T23:59:59+08:00. 

Specify this parameter when you want to change this information.
subscriptionEndTime.descriptionLake:
The date and time when the subscription ends. The default value of this parameter is 2099-12-31T23:59:59+08:00. 

Specify this parameter when you want to change this information.

periodType.description:
The subscription period type. Valid values are:

  • YEAR: indicates that the subscription period is measured in years. 
  • MONTH: indicates that the subscription period is measured in months. 
  • WEEK: indicates that the subscription period is measured in weeks. 
  • DAY: indicates that the subscription period is measured in days.
periodType.descriptionLake:
The subscription period type. Valid values are:

  • YEAR: indicates that the subscription period is measured in years. 
  • MONTH: indicates that the subscription period is measured in months. 
  • WEEK: indicates that the subscription period is measured in weeks. 
  • DAY: indicates that the subscription period is measured in days.

periodCount.description: The number of period types within one subscription period. For example, if the value of periodType is MONTH and the value of periodCount is 2, it means that the subscription period is two months.
periodCount.descriptionLake: The number of period types within one subscription period. For example, if the value of periodType is MONTH and the value of periodCount is 2, it means that the subscription period is two months.

periodRule.description:
The subscription period rule, used to define a subscription's billing period.

Specify this parameter if you want to change this information.
periodRule.descriptionLake:
The subscription period rule, used to define a subscription's billing period.

Specify this parameter if you want to change this information.

subscriptionExpiryTime.description:
A specific date and time after which the created subscription expires. When the subscription expires, the order must be terminated. The default value of this parameter is 30 minutes after the subscription creation request is sent.

Specify this parameter if you want to change the subscription creation expiration time. The specified payment expiration time must be less than 48 hours after the subscription request is sent.
subscriptionExpiryTime.descriptionLake:
A specific date and time after which the created subscription expires. When the subscription expires, the order must be terminated. The default value of this parameter is 30 minutes after the subscription creation request is sent.

Specify this parameter if you want to change the subscription creation expiration time. The specified payment expiration time must be less than 48 hours after the subscription request is sent.

currency.description: The transaction currency that is specified in the contract. A 3-letter currency code that follows the ISO 4217 standard.
currency.descriptionLake: The transaction currency that is specified in the contract. A 3-letter currency code that follows the ISO 4217 standard.

value.description:
The amount to charge as a positive integer in the smallest currency unit. (That is, 100 cents to charge $1.00, or 100 to charge JPY 100, a 0-decimal currency).

Note: For details about the smallest currency unit, see Smallest unit of the currency.
value.descriptionLake:
The amount to charge as a positive integer in the smallest currency unit. (That is, 100 cents to charge $1.00, or 100 to charge JPY 100, a 0-decimal currency).

Note: For details about the smallest currency unit, see Smallest unit of the currency.

orderAmount.description: The order amount of the merchant that directly provides services or goods to the customer. The value of this parameter is displayed on user consumption records or the payment result page.
orderAmount.descriptionLake: The order amount of the merchant that directly provides services or goods to the customer. The value of this parameter is displayed on user consumption records or the payment result page.

orderInfo.description:
The order information of the subscription. This field is used for different purposes:

  • During the payment process, this field is mainly used by Alipay for risk control or anti-money laundering.
  • After the payment is completed, this field is used for recording and reporting purposes such as purchase tracking and regulatory reporting.

Specify this parameter if you want to change this information.
orderInfo.descriptionLake:
The order information of the subscription. This field is used for different purposes:

  • During the payment process, this field is mainly used by Alipay for risk control or anti-money laundering.
  • After the payment is completed, this field is used for recording and reporting purposes such as purchase tracking and regulatory reporting.

Specify this parameter if you want to change this information.

currency.description: The transaction currency, which is a 3-letter currency code that follows the ISO 4217 standard.
currency.descriptionLake: The transaction currency, which is a 3-letter currency code that follows the ISO 4217 standard.

value.description:
The value of the amount as a positive integer in the smallest currency unit. For example, if the currency is USD and the amount is $1.00, set the value of this parameter to 100; or if the currency is JPY and the amount is £¤1, set the value of this parameter to 1.

For details about the smallest currency unit, see Smallest unit of the currency.

For details about the minimum payment amount allowed for each payment method, see Minimum amount rules.
value.descriptionLake:
The value of the amount as a positive integer in the smallest currency unit. For example, if the currency is USD and the amount is $1.00, set the value of this parameter to 100; or if the currency is JPY and the amount is £¤1, set the value of this parameter to 1.

For details about the smallest currency unit, see Smallest unit of the currency.

For details about the minimum payment amount allowed for each payment method, see Minimum amount rules.
value.x-warning: Due to the currency practices in Indonesia, when the currency is IDR, round the amount with Banker's Rounding and fix the last two digits of this parameter as 00.
value.x-warning-lake: Due to the currency practices in Indonesia, when the currency is IDR, round the amount with Banker's Rounding and fix the last two digits of this parameter as 00.

paymentAmount.description:
The payment amount charged to the user per subscription period. 

Specify this parameter if you want to change this information.
paymentAmount.descriptionLake:
The payment amount charged to the user per subscription period. 

Specify this parameter if you want to change this information.

currency.description: The transaction currency, which is a 3-letter currency code that follows the ISO 4217 standard.
currency.descriptionLake: The transaction currency, which is a 3-letter currency code that follows the ISO 4217 standard.

value.description:
The value of the amount as a positive integer in the smallest currency unit. For example, if the currency is USD and the amount is $1.00, set the value of this parameter to 100; or if the currency is JPY and the amount is £¤1, set the value of this parameter to 1.

For details about the smallest currency unit, see Smallest unit of the currency.

For details about the minimum payment amount allowed for each payment method, see Minimum amount rules.
value.descriptionLake:
The value of the amount as a positive integer in the smallest currency unit. For example, if the currency is USD and the amount is $1.00, set the value of this parameter to 100; or if the currency is JPY and the amount is £¤1, set the value of this parameter to 1.

For details about the smallest currency unit, see Smallest unit of the currency.

For details about the minimum payment amount allowed for each payment method, see Minimum amount rules.
value.x-warning: Due to the currency practices in Indonesia, when the currency is IDR, round the amount with Banker's Rounding and fix the last two digits of this parameter as 00.
value.x-warning-lake: Due to the currency practices in Indonesia, when the currency is IDR, round the amount with Banker's Rounding and fix the last two digits of this parameter as 00.

paymentAmountDifference.description:
The payment amount for the initial subscription period after changing the payment amount for subsequent subscription periods. 

Specify this parameter if you change the payment amount for each subscription period.
paymentAmountDifference.descriptionLake:
The payment amount for the initial subscription period after changing the payment amount for subsequent subscription periods. 

Specify this parameter if you change the payment amount for each subscription period.

resultCode.description: The result code. Possible values are listed in the Result/Error codes table on this page.
resultCode.descriptionLake: The result code. Possible values are listed in the Result/Error codes table on this page.

resultStatus.description:
The result status. Valid values are:

  • S: indicates that this API is called successfully.
  • F: indicates that this API call is failed.
  • U: indicates that the API call status is unknown.
resultStatus.descriptionLake:
The result status. Valid values are:

  • S: indicates that this API is called successfully.
  • F: indicates that this API call is failed.
  • U: indicates that the API call status is unknown.

resultMessage.description: Result message that explains the result code.
resultMessage.descriptionLake: Result message that explains the result code.

result.description: Indicates whether this API is called successfully.
result.descriptionLake: Indicates whether this API is called successfully.
result.x-warning: This field does not indicate the subscription change result. Alipay notifies you of the subscription change result through notifySubscription.
result.x-warning-lake: This field does not indicate the subscription change result. Alipay notifies you of the subscription change result through notifySubscription.

x-result.action: The interface is called successfully.
x-result.actionLake: The interface is called successfully.

x-result.action: Contact Alipay Technical Support for detailed reasons.
x-result.actionLake: Contact Alipay Technical Support for detailed reasons.

x-result.message: The client is not authorized to use this API.
x-result.action: Contact Alipay Technical Support for detailed reasons.
x-result.actionLake: Contact Alipay Technical Support for detailed reasons.

x-result.message: The called API is invalid or not active.
x-result.action: Contact Alipay Technical Support to resolve the issue.
x-result.actionLake: Contact Alipay Technical Support to resolve the issue.

x-result.action: Contact Alipay Technical Support for detailed reasons.
x-result.actionLake: Contact Alipay Technical Support for detailed reasons.

x-result.message: The signature is not validated. The private key used to sign a request does not match the public key of Antom Dashboard.
x-result.action:
Check whether the private key used to sign a request matches the public key of Antom Dashboard. The following signature references are useful:

  • The signature field in a request header
  • How to calculate a signature
x-result.actionLake:
Check whether the private key used to sign a request matches the public key of Antom Dashboard. The following signature references are useful:

  • The signature field in a request header
  • How to calculate a signature

x-result.message: The private key or public key of Alipay or the merchant is not found.
x-result.action: Check whether the private key or public key exists. If not, upload the private key in Antom Dashboard.
x-result.actionLake: Check whether the private key or public key exists. If not, upload the private key in Antom Dashboard.

x-result.action: Please register the merchant by using the registration interface. Contact Alipay Technical Support if failed to call the registration interface.
x-result.actionLake: Please register the merchant by using the registration interface. Contact Alipay Technical Support if failed to call the registration interface.

x-result.action: Contact Alipay Technical Support for detailed reasons.
x-result.actionLake: Contact Alipay Technical Support for detailed reasons.

x-result.message: The required parameters are not passed, or illegal parameters exist. For example, a non-numeric input, an invalid date, or the length and type of the parameter are wrong.
x-result.action: Check and verify whether the required request fields (including the header fields and body fields) of the current API are correctly passed and valid.
x-result.actionLake: Check and verify whether the required request fields (including the header fields and body fields) of the current API are correctly passed and valid.

x-result.message: The merchant is not qualified to pay because the merchant is not registered, does not have a contract for Auto Debit payment, or is forbidden to make a payment.
x-result.action: Contact Alipay Technical Support for detailed reasons.
x-result.actionLake: Contact Alipay Technical Support for detailed reasons.

x-result.action: Do not retry. Human intervention is usually needed. It is recommended that you contact Alipay Technical Support to troubleshoot the issue.
x-result.actionLake: Do not retry. Human intervention is usually needed. It is recommended that you contact Alipay Technical Support to troubleshoot the issue.

x-result.message: The transaction cannot be further processed because of risk control. If the user has already paid for the transaction, the transaction will be refunded.
x-result.action: If the user does not receive the refund within two weeks, contact Alipay Technical Support.
x-result.actionLake: If the user does not receive the refund within two weeks, contact Alipay Technical Support.

x-result.action: Contact Alipay Technical Support for detailed reasons.
x-result.actionLake: Contact Alipay Technical Support for detailed reasons.

x-result.message: The request traffic exceeds the limit.
x-result.action: Call the interface again to resolve the issue. If not resolved, contact Alipay Technical Support.
x-result.actionLake: Call the interface again to resolve the issue. If not resolved, contact Alipay Technical Support.

x-result.message: An API call has failed, which is caused by unknown reasons.
x-result.action: Call the interface again to resolve the issue. If not resolved, contact Alipay Technical Support.
x-result.actionLake: Call the interface again to resolve the issue. If not resolved, contact Alipay Technical Support.
